Name: Nigel Reeder
Job/Team Function: The Judicial Appointments Commission (JAC) is an independent commission that selects candidates for judicial office in courts and tribunals in England and Wales, and for some tribunals whose jurisdiction extends to Scotland or Northern Ireland.

Name: Christopher Stephens
Job/Team Function: Whilst for programming reasons the 'grade' of this individual is shown as 'SCS', in fact they are a public appointee and not a civil servant. Non-executive chair of the Judicial Appointments Commission. Responsible for the reviewing the Department's strategic direction, in conjunction with 14 other Commissioners.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Primarily responsible for the management of the selection exercises relating to judiciary appointments to courts and tribunals.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Primarily responsible for supporting the selection exercise programme through operational services such as making interview arrangements and functions such as overall selection exercise programme management. Also responsible for human resources, business services, outreach to candidates for judicial appointments, research and selection policy, including selection of panellists and putting equality and fair treatement at the heart of the JAC and its selection policies. Responsible for official statistics and the operation of the Commission secreatriat.
